subject: Politics
title: Healthcare Politics
description: Learn Healthcare Politics in one minute.

hook.text: Americans pay twice as much for healthcare as Europeans â€” and live shorter lives. The politics are killing them.

buildup.text: Healthcare systems vary from public (UK), to insurance-based (Germany), to mostly private (US).

discovery.text: Universal healthcare exists in every wealthy democracy except the US. The debate there is uniquely political.

twist.text: The US spends 18% of GDP on healthcare. Most goes to insurance companies and administration, not actual care.

climax.text: Healthcare lobbying is the most expensive in Washington. Insurers and pharma spend billions to block reform.

punchline.text: Healthcare is a right or a product. That choice defines a society.

quiz.question: How does US healthcare spending compare to other wealthy nations?
options: Americans pay about twice as much per person with worse health outcomes
The US spends less than most European nations
Spending is equal across all wealthy countries
